net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.builder.components.tags

Class AbstractTagTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.builder.components.tags.AbstractTagTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractActionTagTest, TestBorderLayoutTag, TestButtonLayoutTag, TestButtonTag, TestCheckboxTag, TestComboBoxTag, TestComponentGroupTag, TestConverterTagScript, TestDesktopPanelTag, TestFieldTag, TestIconTag, TestInputComponentTag, TestLabelTag, TestListBoxTag, TestPanelTag, TestPercentLayoutTag, TestProgressBarTag, TestRadioButtonTagScript, TestSliderTag, TestSplitterTag, TestStaticTextTag, TestTabbedPaneTag, TestTableTag, TestTextAreaTag, TestTextFieldTag, TestTextIconData, TestTextListModelTag, TestTransformersWithProperties, TestTreeTagScript

    public abstract class AbstractTagTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

    A base class for testing Jelly tag classes.

    This class provides basic functionality for locating and executing Jelly scripts with form builder tags. The results of these scripts (i.e. the data generated by the builder) can also be compared with expected values. This makes it quite convenient to write test cases for concrete tag classes.

    Version:
    $Id: AbstractTagTest.java 205 2012-01-29 18:29:57Z oheger $
    Author:
    Oliver Heger

      • setUp

        protected void setUp()
              throws Exception
        Sets up this this test class. Initializes the objects needed for script execution.
        Overrides:

      • setUpBuilderData

        protected void setUpBuilderData()
        Initializes the builder data object.

      • setUpJelly

        protected void setUpJelly()
        Sets up the jelly context and XML output. This method also creates a bean context, which accesses the Jelly context (so that all variables stored in the Jelly context can be queried through the bean context).

      • createParentBeanStore

        protected BeanStore createParentBeanStore()
        Creates the parent bean store for the bean context used during script execution. By overriding this method derived classes can inject their own beans into the context used by the script.
        Returns:
        the parent bean store

      • executeScript

        protected void executeScript(String name)
                      throws Exception
        Executes a jelly script. The script is searched in the class path. If necessary, a leading slash and the extension ".jelly" are added.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the script
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • completeScriptName

        protected String completeScriptName(String name)
        Generates the complete script name. Appends an extension if it is missing.
        Parameters:
        name - the script name
        Returns:
        the complete script name

      • executeScript

        protected void executeScript(Locator locator)
                      throws Exception
        Executes a jelly script specified by a Locator.
        Parameters:
        locator - the script locator
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • executeScript

        protected void executeScript(URL url)
                      throws Exception
        Executes a jelly script. The script is specified using a full URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the script URL
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • checkResult

        protected void checkResult(String expected)
        Compares the results of a builder operation with the expected string.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected results

      • checkScript

        protected void checkScript(String scriptName,
                           String expected)
                    throws Exception
        Executes a Jelly form builder script and compares the results with the expected values. This is a convenience method that combines calls of executeScript(String) and checkResult(String).
        Parameters:
        scriptName - the name of the script to be executed
        expected - the expected return value
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • errorScript

        protected void errorScript(String scriptName,
                           String builderName,
                           String msg,
                           boolean callBacks)
                    throws Exception
        Executes a script, optionally executes the builder callbacks, and expects an error.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - the name of the script to be executed
        builderName - the name of the builder to be used
        msg - an error message for the fail() statement
        callBacks - a flag whether the callbacks are to be executed
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of an error

      • errorScript

        protected void errorScript(String scriptName,
                           String builderName,
                           String msg)
                    throws Exception
        Executes a script and expects an error. This is a short form of errorScript(scriptName, builderName, msg, false);.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - the name of the script to be executed
        builderName - the builder name to use
        msg - an error message for the fail() statement
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • createTestScript

        protected Locator createTestScript(String content)
        Creates a test script. This method adds a correct header and footer to the passed in script content. Then the script is packaged into an in memory locator. This locator can be passed to the executeScript() method.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the test script
        Returns:
        the locator pointing to the test script

      • iconLocatorString

        protected static String iconLocatorString()
        Returns a string representation of a locator pointing to the default icon. This string can be used by tag tests that have to deal with icons.
        Returns:
        the text for a locator pointing to the default icon

      • colorString

        protected static String colorString(int r,
                                    int g,
                                    int b)
        Returns a string representation of the color with the given RGB components.
        Parameters:
        r - the value for red
        g - the value for green
        b - the value for blue
        Returns:
        the string representation of this color
